questions.question: What are the coordination modes of D-camphoric acid in the synthesis of the three-dimensional homochiral manganese-lanthanide frameworks?
questions.answer: D-camphoric acid serves as μ2-κ1, κ1, κ1, κ1 (cam-1), μ5-κ2, κ1, κ1, κ1 (cam-2) and μ4-κ1, κ2, κ1 (cam-3) bridging ligands.

questions.question: What is the role of 2,2'-bipyridine in the synthesis of the manganese-lanthanide frameworks?
questions.answer: 2,2'-bipyridine serves as a secondary ligand providing chelating N-donors to cater for hard–soft acid–base theory in order to achieve one-pot assembly.

questions.question: How does the luminescence of polymer 3 compare to the other polymers synthesized?
questions.answer: Polymer 3 exhibits emission peaks at 534, 592, 617, and 690 nm upon excitation at 395 nm, with the most intense emission at 617 nm assigned to the electric-dipole-induced 5D0–7F2 transition, indicating a red emission light, which is distinct from the other polymers.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of the three-dimensional homochiral manganese-lanthanide frameworks involves a two-step self-assembly process.
questions.answer: False. The synthesis involves a one-pot assembly process.

questions.question: What is the significance of using D-camphoric acid in the synthesis of the manganese-lanthanide frameworks?
questions.answer: D-camphoric acid serves as an enantiopure ditopic organic linker to induce a given handedness, contributing to the homochirality of the frameworks.

questions.question: What is the thermal stability sequence of the synthesized polymers based on their thermogravimetric (TG) studies?
questions.answer: The TG studies show a thermo-stability sequence of 2 > 3 > 1 > 4.

questions.question: How do the magnetic susceptibility measurements of polymers 1-4 vary with temperature?
questions.answer: The magnetic susceptibility measurements show that the χmT product decreases continuously as the temperature is lowered, indicating depopulation of the Stark levels.

questions.question: True or False: The luminescent properties of polymers 1-4 are identical.
questions.answer: False. The luminescent properties vary among the polymers, with distinct emission peaks observed for each.

questions.question: What topological structure is observed in the synthesized manganese-lanthanide frameworks when viewed along a certain orientation?
questions.answer: The overall framework can be represented as a six-connected net with a vertex symbol of 4.4.42.4.4.4.4.42.42.64.64.64.64.64.64, showing a hexagonal 3D topological structure when viewed from the orientation of the a-axis.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of the manganese-lanthanide frameworks results in a racemic mixture.
questions.answer: False. The synthesis results in homochiral frameworks due to the use of enantiopure D-camphoric acid.
